00026 using namespace std;
00027 
00028 static const char Usage[] =
00029 "\n"
00030 "\n"
00031 "Usage: orcaroot [options] [input file(s) / socket host:port]\n"
00032 "\n"
00033 "The one required argument is either the name of a file to be processed or\n"
00034 "a host and port of a socket from which to read data. For a file, you may\n"
00035 "enter a series of files to be processed, or use a wildcard like \"file*.dat\"\n"
00036 "For a socket, the argument should be formatted as host:port.\n"
00037 "\n"
00038 "Available options:\n"
00039 "  --help : print this message and exit\n"
00040 "  --verbosity [verbosity] : set the severity/verbosity for the logger.\n"
00041 "    Choices are: debug, trace, routine, warning, error, and fatal.\n"
00042 "  --label [label] : use [label] as prefix for root output file name.\n"
00043 "  --keepalive [time] : keep a socket connection alive if lost.\n"
00044 "    Wait [time] (default 10) seconds between connection attempts.\n"
00045 "  --maxreconnect [num] : Maximum [num] socket reconnect attempts.\n"
00046 "    A [num] value of 0 sets this to infinity (i.e. no timeout).\n"
00047 "  --daemon [port] : Runs as a server accepting connections on [port]. \n" 
00048 "  --connections [num] : Maximum [num] connections accepted by server. \n" 
00049 "\n"
00050 "Example usage:\n"
00051 "orcaroot run194ecpu\n"
00052 "  Rootify local file run194ecpu with default verbosity, output file label, etc.\n"
00053 "orcaroot run*\n"
00054 "  Same as before, but run over all files beginning with \"run\".\n"
00055 "orcaroot --verbosity debug --label mylabel run194ecpu\n"
00056 "  The same, but with example usage of the verbosity and mylabel options.\n"
00057 "  An output file will be created with name mylabel_run194.root, and lots\n"
00058 "  of debugging output will appear.\n"
00059 "orcaroot 128.95.100.213:44666\n"
00060 "  Rootify orca stream on host 128.95.100.213, port 44666 with default verbosity,\n"
00061 "  output file label, etc.\n"
00062 "orcaroot --daemon 9090 --connections 10\n"
00063 "  Start orcaroot as a server on port 9090, accepting a maximum number of 10 connections.\n" 
00064 "\n"
00065 "\n";
00066 
00067 
00068 int main(int argc, char** argv)
00069 {
00070         if(argc == 1) {
00071                 ORLog(kError) << "You must supply some options" << endl << Usage;
00072                 return 1;
00073         }
00074         
00075         
00076         static struct option longOptions[] = {
00077                 {"help", no_argument, 0, 'h'},
00078                 {"verbosity", required_argument, 0, 'v'},
00079                 {"label", required_argument, 0, 'l'},
00080                 {"keepalive", optional_argument, 0, 'k'},
00081                 {"maxreconnect", required_argument, 0, 'm'},
00082                 {"daemon", required_argument, 0, 'd'},
00083                 {"connections", required_argument, 0, 'c'}
00084         };
00085         
00086         string label = "OR";
00087         ORVReader* reader = NULL;
00088         
00089         bool keepAliveSocket = false;
00090         bool runAsDaemon = false;
00091         unsigned long timeToSleep = 10; //default sleep time for sockets.
00092         unsigned int reconnectAttempts = 0; // default reconnect tries for sockets.
00093         unsigned int portToListenOn = 0;
00094         unsigned int maxConnections = 5; // default connections accepted by server
00095         
00096         while(1) {
00097                 char optId = getopt_long(argc, argv, "", longOptions, NULL);
00098                 if(optId == -1) break;
00099                 switch(optId) {
00100                         case('h'): // help
00101                                 cout << Usage;
00102                                 return 0;
00103                         case('v'): // verbosity
00104                                 if(strcmp(optarg, "debug") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kDebug);
00105                                 else if(strcmp(optarg, "trace") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kTrace);
00106                                 else if(strcmp(optarg, "routine") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kRoutine);
00107                                 else if(strcmp(optarg, "warning") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kWarning);
00108                                 else if(strcmp(optarg, "error") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kError);
00109                                 else if(strcmp(optarg, "fatal") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kFatal);
00110                                 else {
00111                                         ORLog(kWarning) << "Unknown verbosity setting " << optarg 
00112                                         << "; using kRoutine" << endl;
00113                                         ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kRoutine);
00114                                 }
00115                                 break;
00116                         case('l'): // label
00117                                 label = optarg;
00118                                 break;
00119                         case('k'):
00120                                 if(!optarg) keepAliveSocket = true;
00121                                 else {
00122                                         keepAliveSocket = true;
00123                                         timeToSleep = abs(atol(optarg));
00124                                 }
00125                                 break;
00126                         case('m'):
00127                                 reconnectAttempts = abs(atoi(optarg));
00128                                 break;
00129                         case('d'):
00130                                 reconnectAttempts = 0;
00131                                 keepAliveSocket = false;
00132                                 runAsDaemon = true;
00133                                 portToListenOn = abs(atol(optarg));
00134                                 break;
00135                         case('c'):
00136                                 maxConnections = abs(atoi(optarg));
00137                                 break;
00138                         default: // unrecognized option
00139                                 ORLog(kError) << Usage;
00140                                 return 1;
00141                 }
00142         }
00143         
00144         if (argc <= optind && !runAsDaemon) {
00145                 ORLog(kError) << "You must supply a filename or socket host:port" << endl
00146                 << Usage << endl;
00147                 return 1;
00148         }
00149         
00150         ORHandlerThread* handlerThread = new ORHandlerThread();
00151         handlerThread->StartThread();
00152         /***************************************************************************/
00153         /*   Running orcaroot as a daemon server. */
00154         /***************************************************************************/
00155         if (runAsDaemon) {
00156                 /* Here we start listening on a socket for connections. */
00157                 /* We are doing this very simply with a simple fork. Eventually want
00158                  to check number of spawned processes, etc.  */
00159                 ORLog(kRoutine) << "Running orcaroot as daemon on port: " << portToListenOn << endl;
00160                 pid_t childpid = 0;
00161                 std::set<pid_t> childPIDRecord;
00162                 
00163                 ORServer* server = new ORServer(portToListenOn);
00164                 /* Starting server, binding to a port. */
00165                 if (!server->IsValid()) {
00166                         ORLog(kError) << "Error listening on port " << portToListenOn 
00167                         << endl << "Error code: " << server->GetErrorCode() << endl;
00168                         return 1;
00169                 }
00170                 while (1) {
00171                         /* This while loop is broken by a kill signal which is well handled
00172                          * by the server.  The kill signal will automatically propagate to the
00173                          * children so we really don't have to worry about waiting for them to
00174                          * die.  */
00175                         while (childPIDRecord.size() >= maxConnections) { 
00176                                 /* We've reached our maximum number of child processes. */
00177                                 /* Wait for a process to end. */
00178                                 childpid = wait3(0, WUNTRACED, 0);
00179                                 if(childPIDRecord.erase(childpid) != 1) {
00180                                         /* Something really weird happened. */
00181                                         ORLog(kError) << "Ended child process " << childpid 
00182                                         << " not recognized!" << endl;
00183                                 }
00184                         }
00185                         while((childpid = wait3(0,WNOHANG,0)) > 0) {
00186                                 /* Cleaning up any children that may have ended.                   * 
00187                                  * This will just go straight through if no children have stopped. */
00188                                 if(childPIDRecord.erase(childpid) != 1) {
00189                                         /* Something really weird happened. */
00190                                         ORLog(kError) << "Ended child process " << childpid 
00191                                         << " not recognized!" << endl;
00192                                 }
00193                         } 
00194                         ORLog(kRoutine) << childPIDRecord.size()  << " connections running..." << endl;
00195                         ORLog(kRoutine) << "Waiting for connection..." << endl;
00196                         TSocket* sock = server->Accept(); 
00197                         if (sock == (TSocket*) 0 || sock == (TSocket*) -1 ) {
00198                                 // There was an error, or the socket got closed .
00199                                 if (!server->IsValid()) return 0;
00200                                 continue;
00201                         }
00202                         if(!sock->IsValid()) {
00203                                 /* Invalid socket, cycle to wait. */
00204                                 delete sock;
00205                                 continue;
00206                         }
00207                         if ((childpid = fork()) == 0) {
00208                                 /* We are in the child process.  Set up reader and fire away. */
00209                                 delete server;
00210                                 delete handlerThread;
00211                                 handlerThread = new ORHandlerThread;
00212                                 handlerThread->StartThread();
00213                                 reader = new ORSocketReader(sock, true);
00214                                 /* Get out of the while loop */
00215                                 break;
00216                         } 
00217                         /* Parent process: wait for next connection. Close our descriptor. */
00218                         ORLog(kRoutine) << "Connection accepted, child process begun with pid: " 
00219                         << childpid << endl;
00220                         childPIDRecord.insert(childpid);
00221                         delete sock; 
00222                 }
00223                 /***************************************************************************/
00224                 /*  End daemon server code.  */
00225                 /***************************************************************************/
00226         } else {
00227                 /* Normal running, either connecting to a server or reading in a file. */
00228                 string readerArg = argv[optind];
00229                 size_t iColon = readerArg.find(":");
00230                 if (iColon == string::npos) {
00231                         reader = new ORFileReader;
00232                         for (int i=optind; i<argc; i++) {
00233                                 ((ORFileReader*) reader)->AddFileToProcess(argv[i]);
00234                         }
00235                 } 
00236                 else {
00237                         reader = new ORSocketReader(readerArg.substr(0, iColon).c_str(), 
00238                                                                                 atoi(readerArg.substr(iColon+1).c_str()));
00239                 }
00240         }
00241         if (!reader->OKToRead()) {
00242                 ORLog(kError) << "Reader couldn't read" << endl;
00243                 return 1;
00244         }
00245         
00246         ORLog(kRoutine) << "Setting up data processing manager..." << endl;
00247         ORDataProcManager dataProcManager(reader);
00248         
00249         /* Declare processors here. */
00250         //ORMCA927Decoder mca927Decoder;
00251         ORMCA927TreeWriter mca927Tree("MCA927Tree");
00252         OROrcaRequestProcessor orcaReq;
00253 
00254         ORLog(kRoutine) << "Starting output file writer..." << endl;
00255         ORFileWriter fileWriter(label);
00256         
00257         if (runAsDaemon) {
00258                 /* Add them here if you wish to run them in daemon mode ( not likely ).*/
00259                 dataProcManager.AddProcessor(&orcaReq);
00260         } else {
00261                 /* Add the processors here to run them in normal mode. */
00262                 dataProcManager.AddProcessor(&mca927Tree);
00263                 dataProcManager.AddProcessor(&fileWriter);
00264         }
00265         
00266         ORLog(kRoutine) << "Start processing..." << endl;
00267         dataProcManager.ProcessDataStream();
00268         ORLog(kRoutine) << "Finished processing..." << endl;
00269         
00270         delete reader;
00271         delete handlerThread;
00272         
00273         return 0;
00274 }
